title: These are the four Irish actors tipped as 'ones to watch' in 2018
excerpt: Keep an eye on this lot.
content:
FOUR IRISH ACTORS have been selected as Screen International‚Äôs Stars of Tomorrow.

[image id="image_1"]

The industry publication has form in recognising rising talent, picking the likes of Benedict Cumberbatch, Eddie Redmayne, and Carey Mulligan before they were famous.

Among this year‚Äôs selections are actress Chewing Gum‚Äôs Michaela Coel and Rogue One‚Äôs James Harkness, along with four Irish selections.

Irish producer¬†Farah Abushwesha also earned a place on the list.

So, who are the four actors?

Se√°na Kerslake

[image id="image_2"]

You‚Äôll know her from A Date for Mad Mary, or Can‚Äôt Cope, Won‚Äôt Cope. If you‚Äôre a big Irish film fan, you‚Äôll have seen her early on in Kirsten Sheridan‚Äôs Dollhouse.

Patrick Gibson

[embed id="embed_3"]

[image id="image_3"]

Patrick got international attention this year when he appeared in Netflix‚Äôs buzzy series, The OA. Before that, he appeared in The Tudors, Gold, Neverland, and Lenny Abrahamson‚Äôs What Richard Did.

Gibson went to Trinity College until he got the call for The OA. It seems to be all working out.

[embed id="embed_1"]

His upcoming projects include a comedy In A Relationship with Emma Roberts, and a lead role in an adaption of The Darkest Minds, a young-adult trilogy about supernatural teens.

Fionn O‚ÄôShea

[image id="image_4"]

Fionn gained recognition for his role in the endearing Handsome Devil. Before that, he appeared in Oscar-nominated short New Boy, and Netflix movie The Seige of Jadotville. He recently completed a Second World War drama The Aftermath with Keira Knightly and Alexander Skarsgard and is now working on a Channel 4 comedy Hang Ups with Stephen Mangan.

Jessie Buckley

[image id="image_5"]

Raised in Kilarney, Jessie focused mostly on theatre until this year. She appeared on the 2008 reality series I‚Äôd Do Anything to earn the role of Nancy in.

She appeared in a TV adaptation of War and Peace for the BBC and thriller Taboo. Other projects she‚Äôs been involved with include Beast, The Woman in White, and Tom Harper‚Äôs Country Music.

DailyEdge is on Instagram!

title: The Hills' Heidi and Spencer Pratt have welcomed a baby boy called Gunner... it's the Dredge
excerpt: It’s a new week full of celeb dirt.
content:
EVERY WEEKDAY MORNING, DailyEdge.ie rounds up the best of the day‚Äôs celebrity dirt¬†from¬†the top to the very bottom.¬†

[embed id="embed_1"]

The Hills stars Heidi and Spencer have welcomed their first baby boy! The couple welcomed baby Gunner Stone yesterday and Spencer described it as ‚Äúofficially the most lit day of my life‚Äù.

So elegant.

They also claim to have had almost ‚Ç¨23,000 worth of crystals at the birth. For some reason.

[embed id="embed_2"]

Kylie Jenner has apparently already spent over $70,000 on ‚Äòhigh end baby clothes‚Äô. How high end can you get?

[embed id="embed_3"]

According to TMZ, the 20-year-old splashed the cash online, with an insider saying it‚Äôs going to be the best dressed baby we‚Äôve ever seen.

[embed id="embed_5"]

We still have no actual confirmation that Kylie is pregnant at all, but reports claim she‚Äôs four months along with boyfriend Travis Scott‚Äôs tot.

The Hollywood reporter has tipped Saoirse Ronan to win an Oscar this year. The US movie bible compiled a list of frontrunners using various methods and predictions, and claimed that Saoirse would grab her third nomination for her role in Lady Bird.

[image id="image_1"]

She is set to go up against Jessica Chastain, Frances McDormand, Sally Hawkins and Margot Robbie, if the publication is correct.

The same columnist claimed Liam Neeson is a long shot for his role in Mark Felt, the Man Who Brought Down the White House.

And the rest of the day‚Äôs dirt‚Ä¶

Eh, have we seen Mariah Carey‚Äòs weird interview on GMB? (The Mirror)

Kendrick Lamar is coming to Dublin in February! (Instagram)

Speaking of The Hills, Justin Bobby and Audrina Partridge are apparently back in touch! (Buzzfeed)

Helen Mirren and Jane Fonda absolutely owned the catwalk at Paris Fashion Week (Daily Mail)

DailyEdge is on Instagram!

[embed id="embed_4"]

title: Balenciaga tried to make platform Crocs happen at Paris Fashion Week but no one is having it
content:
STOP EVERYTHING. Crocs are back.

[image id="image_1"]

The ugliest shoe in the world made a grand return during Paris Fashion week. Fashion house Balenciaga showcased some crocs during their show yesterday, and people aren‚Äôt really sure how to react.

But they weren‚Äôt just average crocs. No, these are platform crocs

[embed id="embed_1"]

My God

[image id="image_2"]

[embed id="embed_6"]

People were shocked to their core

[embed id="embed_2"]

[embed id="embed_3"]

In a statement, Michelle Poole from Crocs said:

When Balenciaga approached us, we were intrigued by the opportunity to push the boundaries of our design and molding capabilities to see what we could create together. Working with Balenciaga has been so much fun for our team, and once again demonstrates the relevance of our iconic clog in today‚Äôs fashion and design world, as well as allowing us to tap into the excitement and energy that comes from unexpected partnerships.

Yeah, it was unexpected alright

[embed id="embed_4"]

The limited edition Crocs will only be available in Balenciaga stores and on its website next Spring. Don‚Äôt all rush at once now.

DailyEdge is on Instagram!

[embed id="embed_5"]

title: The busking brothers from Wicklow divided the X Factor judges at bootcamp last night
excerpt: It’s time to get behind these two.
content:
BUSKING BROTHERS Conor and Sean Price from Blessington in Wicklow seriously impressed judges at their first X Factor audition in Edinburgh a few weeks ago.

[image id="image_1"]

They flew through to boot camp, which was finally aired last night. The duo performed Beggin by Madcon at Wembly in front of 4,000 people, but it didn‚Äôt go down as well as their first audition.

Simon said it was the least favourite performance he‚Äôd seen by the 17 and 15-year olds, and stopped them just seconds into the song.

[image id="image_2"]

But all hope wasn‚Äôt lost.

[embed id="embed_5"]

They performed Sing by Ed Sheeran, to much better results, and are now through to next week‚Äôs six-chair challenge

[image id="image_3"]

They were only delighted

[image id="image_4"]

People already have them down as their winners

[embed id="embed_1"]

[embed id="embed_2"]

[embed id="embed_3"]

DailyEdge is on Instagram!

title: 8 ubiquitous Instagram beauty trends that need to die already
content:
WE LOVE SCROLLING through Instagram for makeup inspiration just as much as the next gal, but it‚Äôs time to face the facts: Things are getting ridiculous over there.

Here are a few trends that need to go, PRONTO.

1. Dripping the foundation on to your face straight from the bottle

[image id="image_1"]

That‚Äôs so much product! Not to mention ‚Äì one false move and you and everything you own will be destroyed. You‚Äôre giving me a heart attack, girls.

2. Useless colour correcting

[image id="image_2"]

At the risk of sounding like your granny: That‚Äôs only messing, so it is. Messing!

3. Concealing almost half your face

[image id="image_3"]

Two triangles under the eyes, one on the forehead and one for the chin, a strip down the nose‚Ä¶ Did we not just apply a full face of foundation? What is this for? Pls explain.

4. Highlighting the nose into oblivion

[embed id="embed_6"]

[embed id="embed_1"]

A beaming snozz mostly looks daft in real life, sorry.

5. Those creepy grey contact lenses

[embed id="embed_2"]

At some point in the last year, every Instagram MUA somehow acquired wolflike grey eyes. The uncanny valley effect is extreme.

6. Photoshopped eyeshadow photos

[embed id="embed_3"]

The look might be achievable, but you‚Äôll never know cos it‚Äôs been smoothed and perfected by an editing app. How, Sway?

7. Fake freckles

[embed id="embed_4"]

Not fooled.

8. And applying makeup using truly ridiculous items

[image id="image_4"]

We‚Äôve seen red peppers, sanitary towels, fidget spinners, and yep, that‚Äôs a condom. CEASE AND DESIST.

DailyEdge is on Instagram!

[embed id="embed_5"]
